basics.name: Julian Brown
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Highly motivated software engineer with experience writing software in Go, Java, and C++. Also experienced in building fast, responsive, and accessible websites using core web technologies. A self-starter and passionate about devops, developer productivity, high performance software and distributed systems.

work.summary: Infrastructure SME/Lead for the Consulting Team
highlights: Built Yext Pages sites (bespoke static landing pages) for Fortune 500 clients using ES6 Javascript, Sass, Webpack, and Soy templates (e.g cafe.haagen-dazs.es.yext-cdn.com).
Decreased CI/CD build times by 80% for the Consulting Engineering monorepo by migrating our build system from Make to Bazel.
Improved developer productivity by building a CI tool to serve pull requests to Yext Pages sites using Go, Docker, Nginx, and Jenkins.
Prevented incidents and reduced resolution times by building a monitoring/alerting system for ETLs, Jobs, 600+ Pages sites managed by Consulting using Go, Prometheus, and Alertmanager.
Enabled teammates by writing codelabs, hosting brown bags and keeping documentation up to date.
Wrote file system libraries with unit and integration tests in C as part common flight software used by other teams.
Modeled embedded components for the Cygnus Spacecraft in C++ for SITL and HITL simulation testing.

work.summary: Study of perturbations generated by stratified incompressible thermo-hydrodynamics (PI. Dr. Paterson)
highlights: Ran CFD simulations on HokieSpeed using OpenFOAM and Python
Constructed 3D images of flow from 2D images using python and ParaVIEW.
Developed a GUI rocket motor sizing application (RocketSolver) in C# to reduce preliminary rocket motor design time for other engineers.

work.summary: Utilization Of Wind Tunnel With Porous Flexible Wall For Aerodynamic Measurement (Pi. Dr. Devenport)
highlights: Automated Digital Image Correlation measurements and data processing with Python.

work.summary: Modeling of a Hall Effect thruster using C++ (FA. Dr. Srinivasan)
highlights: Produced real time visual simulations charged particles within a Hall Effect thruster using C++ and OpenGL.

work.summary: Impedance Based Structural Health Monitoring Of Hybrid ZnO Smart Composites (Pi: Dr. Philen).
highlights: Automated testing and data processing of ZnO smart composites using LabVIEW and Python
